text: speed racer is the new film written and
directed by Andy and larry wachowski the
brothers who brought us the matrix
movies and it's their first movie that
they've written and directed since the
last Matrix movie it's based of course
on the beloved old Japanese cartoon
about Speed Racer a racecar driver who
has various adventures involving Trixie
his loyal girlfriend and sidekick if I
recall correctly a chimpanzee and also a
mysterious car racer named Racer X are
moving all of those elements are here in
this feature film which is a live-action
movie starring Emile Hirsch and
Christina Ricci and Matthew Fox Susan
Sarandon John Goodman quite an
impressive human cast all set against
digitized backgrounds and this movie is
often interesting to look at and
sometimes impressive there are some
popping bright colors everywhere but the
action sequences which are supposedly
the Wachowskis great claim to fame are
pretty incoherent and hard to follow and
these digital race cars sort of zip
around and flip around and you don't
really know what the physical laws of
this universe really are the bigger
problem is just that the story is just
so incoherent and slow and you can't
figure out what's happening the first
half hour is just a complete mess it
goes from flash back to something
happening in the present you don't know
who the characters are why they're doing
what they're doing and for a movie with
a title that's so full of velocity it's
called speed racer and it is so slow and
painfully long 2 hours and 15 minutes
goes under now I guess the intention
behind this movie as is so often the
case with movies based on comic books or
old TV shows is to kind of refresh a pop
cultural brand and let some of the
grown-ups in the audience have a little
rush of nostalgia while the kids have a
whole bunch of new cool characters and
stuff to look at the problem here is
that the characters don't really come to
the for Speed Racer himself is sort of
bland and square-jawed his dad played by
John Goodman is kind of a funny grumpy
old guy there's a story about a
corporation that's trying to
control racing there's the mystery of
whether Racer X is or is not really
speeds dead older brother there's a
whole lot going on but it doesn't add up
to very much and after a while you don't
feel enthralled or dazzled or entertain
you just feel worn down and headachy and
tired and you wish the movie would just
either slow down or hurry up and get
somewhere
